headline: Couture for Bodies  In Motion
abstract: An exhibition at the Centre National du Costume de Scène in France considers the dialogue between the stage and the runway.
lead_paragraph: MOULINS, France — Soft jersey bathing suits, molded on the body, fitted pink cloche caps framing the face. These were Coco Chanel’s simple yet revolutionary designs for the Ballets Russes’s “Le Train Bleu” (1924), a dance about gilded youth at the seaside, doing calisthenics and playing tennis and golf.
